author: {'steamid': '76561198022227319', 'num_games_owned': 4476, 'num_reviews': 221, 'playtime_forever': 2846, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2810, 'last_played': 1674083081}
review:
[h1]Overview:[/h1]
'[i]Demolition Inc.[/i]' is a top down strategy game based around the idea of destroying specified sections of a city in the most efficient way possible. You play as "Mike", an alien demolition expert working for '[i]SCEP[/i]' a company who had apparently [b]bought[/b] the entire planet and has tasked you to level every city you can in order for them to rebuild the planet into a recreational spot. Funny enough, I went through the beginning cutscene where Mike receives an e-mail detailing the job but found out that the acronym supposedly used for the company doesn't even line up with what the actual name of the company is. '[i]SCEP[/i]' from the looks of it stands for "Society for the protection of endangered planets" but wouldn't that mean the acronym should be '[i]SPEP[/i]', not '[i]SCEP[/i]'. There might be something else to it but I just found that funny.

The game isn't [i]bad[/i] but it definitely wasn't what I was expecting when I first bought it over a decade ago. What appears to be a very fun and casual game is met with a rather disappointing and somewhat frustrating gameplay structure which I'll get into.

[h1]Gameplay:[/h1]
'[i]Demolition Inc.[/i]' throws you into Mike's shoes as he hovers over sectioned parts of a city placing down various hazards to cause havoc in hopes that the chaos will level the buildings he needs to get rid of. The main idea is to manipulate traffic in a way that will cause vehicles to ram into the sides of buildings in order to topple them over. You do this by placing down different items ranging from oil spills that prevent cars from turning, gooey traps to force them to steer a certain direction and exploding cows (yeah don't ask) that detonate when a vehicle drives into it. These are just a few of many items Mike can use to achieve his goal and if he doesn't do it fast enough, the military comes and it's game over.

Why Mike can't just take them down himself is beyond me but who knows, maybe it's part of the contract. Now that we got the basic gameplay elements out of the way you might be wondering, what makes '[i]Demolition Inc.[/i]' not as good as it could have been? Well, a big part of it lies within it's gameplay style and the issues many people had with it. The main issue is the idea of having to strategically place hazards as to cause as much destruction with any one item used. This means a huge part of the game consists of the player needing to be very selective with their items and figuring out which item would work best where.

Now that doesn't sound too bad especially for a game with strategy incorporated into it and honestly, it isn't during the early stages of the game. It's actually quite fun. It's during the later stages where things start to get a lot more annoying. Items become scarcer and options for completing the objective are just as limited. And might I add, this is just to successfully beat the level, I haven't even gotten to the Star Ranking yet. The goal is to destroy all the high rise buildings in the level but in order to get a 3 star rating (which is required to unlock all the worlds), you have to do it using as little items as possible in the least amount of time.

You only start off with a select number of items and although it's possible to obtain more through destroying buildings with item crates on them, they don't help much in later areas. In some levels it's fine as the layout is pretty straight forward but there are plenty of levels where there's no sense of direction to pin your focus on. This is where the developers try to encourage players to be creative and find their own way of clearing the level but when you're only giving them a fraction of the tools they need to get the job done then what can they do?

Well that's where the "Black Cow Market" comes in, a special shop where you can buy expensive upgrades that supposedly make the game easier. Starting with the one time use items, the Black Cow is basically an exploding cow with a crazy radius that ultimately helps when you're stuck in a pickle but guess what? It disables leaderboards and exempts the 3 star rating so what's the point? Then there's an item to call off the military if you end up running out of time which I guess is helpful.

Then there are the upgrades that don't expire. There are 4 from which 2 of them make collecting debris for extra money easier. One of them increases the max combo to 4 and the last one gives you a 20% discount for mission items not counting the Black Cow Market. Now this is where I started scratching my head because from what I know, the Black Cow Market is the only store in the game so this discount is completely useless as it serves literally no purpose. I might be missing something but during my entire playthrough there wasn't a single moment where this upgrade came in handy. So there you have it, a lucrative store that sells some of the most useless upgrades.

I honestly feel like the developers should've made the destruction the core aspect of the game and saved all the stingy item strategizing as a challenge mode or something. Either that or give players the options to buy extra items with money earned. I mean there's a rampage mode where you can wreak all the havoc you want but it's just not the same without the sense of progression.

[h1]Controls:[/h1]
Basic enough adopting a point-and-click style of gameplay where you pan over a map with W,A,S,D and left click to place hazards. I haven't run into any bugs but when you press 4, the game zooms down to ground level and you're stuck in limbo until you restart so, yeah. Don't press 4.

[h1]Graphics:[/h1]
Not too bad for 2011 standards. Although I can safely say graphic potential in 2011 far surpassed what '[i]Demolition Inc.[/i]' looks like (queue '[i]Crysis[/i]') memes), it also doesn't look bad for what it is. Destroying buildings despite seeming like you're taking down paper structures is still satisfying enough to look at. Stack that on top of the domino effect mechanic that the developers implemented and it honestly is pretty good for it's time. It's kind of awesome knowing that pretty much everything in the city can be destroy. Hell, even the people roaming the streets can get caught in your demolition job and turn into angels. All in all, dated but for it's time, it's not half bad.

[h1]Audio:[/h1]
Also not terrible all things considered. The sound effects are fine and fit in perfectly with the world and there's quite a few different music choices which helps with not getting tired of the music after 5 minutes. The intro sequence throws rather heavy rock music while the main menu greets you with a jazzy upbeat track. Meanwhile the actual levels introduce multiple tracks that range from soft rock music to low town jazz themed around city life and space. It's actually pretty cool.

[h1]Conclusion/TL;DR:[/h1]
'[i]Demolition Inc.[/i]' is a top down strategy game where you destroy buildings as efficiently as you can with the items provided. If you're expecting a spree of destruction and mindless chaos you'll be pretty disappointed as most of the game consists of the player needing to conserve and use very specific items in certain spots in order to achieve the score needed to pass the level. It just ends up being a trial and error marathon until the player finally finds one of few ways to beat the level. It isn't a terrible structure but it [i]does[/i] becomes underwhelming when players that expect to be able to destroy lots of stuff end up discovering they can only destroy what they need to.

review:
For a game based around demolition and causing as much chaos, explosions and thus destruction as possible, it is frustratingly linear and unforgiving. You need absolute precision in how you use your items, how you steer cars, the timing of what you use along with a vicious timer and scoring system and it ends up being far more punishing, trial and error and difficult than it should be.

This is an amazing concept executed really badly. It has some love put into it and the workshop inclusion is a massive plus and very appreciated but the main game is unfortunately just completely missing the point in what this should be. 

Also definitely does feel like a mobile game too as some other said. I tried to give this so many chances and look on the upside but the awkward controls and menus make this even more aggravating to play too. Many mistakes and stuck situations happened because playing with a controller is so sloppy on this.

I can only really recommend this for the very masochistic er I mean "patient" and those who love trial and error and such.

[h1] Unwanted Destruction[/h1]

[b] What I Liked [/b]

It's a stupid little game where you try to destroy as much as you can.  That was entertaining.

[b] What I Did Not Like [/b]

Basically the premise was to destroy stuff, that's it.  The gameplay is as deep as a puddle.

[b] Why I Stopped Playing [/b]

It held my attention for an afternoon, then I grew bored, so I moved on.

[b] Disclaimer [/b]

I have been a gamer for over 30 years.  I tend to play mostly PC games.  I also bounce around between games A LOT.  I may purchase a $60 game and play it for 2 hours or spend $10 on a game and spend 50 hours on it.  Even if I played a game a short time, it does not mean it is bad.  It just means another game caught my attention.  I also complain about flaws in games a lot, even about the littlest of things.  Keep that in mind when reading my reviews.  If I do not have a complaint, then the game must be special!

Wir leben ja nicht mehr im Jahre 1995 wo man mit einem 1024x768 Monitor ein absoluter Exot war. Ich kenne mehr Leute die ihren PC am Fernseher angeschlossen haben, als Leute die noch am Monitor zocken. [b]4k ist heute STANDARD![/b] Wer das nicht rafft, der möchte sich doch bitte aus der Gamingindustrie zurück ziehen und die Arbeit den Profis überlassen.

review:

review:
Una categoría de estrategia diferente propone este juego. Desde el platillo volador se controla lo que se ha de dejar caer sobre la ciudad y sus consecuencias. Una mancha de aceite para que un automóvil siga de largo y se estrelle contra un objetivo estratégico que desate una reacción en cadena, una vaca explosiva que sirva de puente para hacer volar un edificio entero. Con un limitado arsenal que va aumentando conforme se avanza ha de destruírse una zona específica antes de que llegue la armada y acabe con la diversión. Pareciera muy simple pero cuando los mapas van creciendo la dificultad aumenta y hace falta calcular qué y cómo se va a realizar para no quedar desarmado y con objetivos pendientes. Adicionalmente hay objetivos opcionales ocasionalmente muy díficiles de cumplir en vista de tal devastación. Ayudar a cruzar la calle una abuelita puede ser un problema si se encuentra en medio de las muchas explosiones que ofrece el título. 
El apartado técnico es cumplidor, modesto pero desmedidamente exigente para lo que ofrece. En una GTX 970 SSC y un i7 4790K se presentan bajones de FPS. Me divertí mucho y todavía me divierte.
No basta con estar en el platillo volador si no llevas tu cerebro porque te hará falta.

review:
I love this game. It's been my default "go to" game whenever I have some time to kill or just feel like blowing things up for no obvious reason. With the DLC installed, in particular, some of the storyline challenges are no easy task - there is no free run to the finish line.

The workshop adds a whole new layer of fun/challenge/wtf, with enough uploaded content to keep the game going for days. With "Create a game level" as one of the achievements, there is a lot of chaff in with the wheat; but a good explore of the workshop levels is hugely rewarding.

I've found creating game levels for the workshop generally entertaining, whith a few small quirks that take a little getting used to [and are probably more indicative of my own lack of experience with making game levels, than with this game in particular]. Above all, the game creator has been a brilliant place to escape to when I've had trouble getting through in-game levels, and just want to take a break for a while.

Overall: an absolute favourite game, not especially complex but tremendous fun to play. Should be much better known than it is. Highly recommended, especially for the fan of blowing stuff up.

review:
This game has been a really pleasant surprise.
What can I say about this game... It's amazing.
Casual & fun destruction based physics game.
Sure, there are some limitations to the engine.
Most of these negative reviews mention them.
And yes, It's true. The game is linear and easy.
The content is quite small, It's truly very short.
But for such a low price, I think it's quite good.
Especially worth it during a discount, or a sale.
I had my three hours of fun with it, It was nice.
One of those neat old-school mayhem games.
It sort of plays like a retro game in many ways.
Even though it is from 2011, It just feels older.
That's not a bad thing, though. I do love retro.
It reminds me a little of "Destroy All Humans"
You fly around in your saucer, creating chaos.
Truly just a fun game, very casual experience.
And I just had to give this my positive review.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008369673', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 196, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 196, 'last_played': 1406941495}
review:
This is an alright game.

Nice and simple way of playing it yet makes you think on how best to employ the best strategy to level the buildings with the tools at your disposal and from what you can find around the level itself.

Pretty toonish design of the game adds to the charm of it along with some pretty neat tools to deploy to help destroy the city in as creative a way as possible and makes you consider on where to place said tools for maximum efficency.  

Though I do question the physics of the game slightly.  I played one level and crashed 3 cars into a building that was already damaged, yet the building stood firm and defiant and that cost me the level.  Plus having to retry can cause some previous effects from your last try to still be in play and not reset properly after, resulting in the army coming for you straight away.

Also I have  been having crashing issues here and there with the game, so beware of that.

Music though, quite catchy, pretty good and suits the game very well.

As I look at the price currently, it stands at £4.79.  Its a push, but yes its a fair price for it, though get it on sale if possible.  Its a fine game, could be better with more polish and attention, but its workable and it will eat time like no other as you try and find solutions to destroy the target city, so thats a good thing going for it for sure.  Pick it up if you want to try something a bit different thats cheap and a good time killer.

author: {'steamid': '76561198023800832', 'num_games_owned': 645, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 697, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 636, 'last_played': 1406050687}
review:
Demolition Inc. ist ein kurzweiliges aber dennoch recht spaßiges Puzzlespiel.

Man ist ein Alien mit dem Auftrag Gebäude auf der Erde abzureißen um für Pflanzen und Bäume zu sorgen. Man hat dafür verschiedene Werkzeuge wie Öllachen oder Reifenkleber, mit denen man Autos mehr oder weniger gezielt in Häuser und ähnliches rasen lassen muss. Die Anzahl der Werkzeuge ist gering, jedoch ist das kombinieren manchmal recht knifflig. Da jedoch die meisten Lösungswege vom Leveldesign her erkennbar sind, ist es nie zu schwer. Viele Level lassen sich auch anders als gewollt lösen ;D

Die Grafik ist sehr simpel gehalten, jedoch vollkommen ok. Einzig die Wetter- und Sonneneffekte haben mich gestört, da manche Schatten dann echt ungünstig standen und mir so echt die Sicht vermiest haben >:( 
Die Musik ist unglaublich eintönig und langweilig (da immer das gleiche), also entweder man dreht den Sound runter oder überhört es einfach.

Viele Level gibt es leider nicht, der Schwierigkeitsgrad varriiert immer und große Überraschungen gibt es nicht, auch nicht im Level & Weapon DLC. Der bringt nochmal einen Schwung neuer Level und einige neue Waffen, Innovatives sucht man jedoch vergebens. 

Alles in allem ist Demolition Inc. ein kurzweiliges, ganz nett gemachtes Puzzlespiel, bei dem jedoch das gewisse Etwas fehlt. Daher eigentlich eine neutrale Wertung: kann man mal spielen, muss man aber nicht.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044146972', 'num_games_owned': 462, 'num_reviews': 300, 'playtime_forever': 163, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 154, 'last_played': 1707719755}
review:
I bought Demolition Inc. on sale after seeing the trailer. It looked like a fun puzzle blow up so I gave it a shot.

What I really liked about the game is the variety you use to destroy what you need to destroy. The goal of the game is to bring down all the buildings in the area and to raise green areas. How you do it though is up to you and the resources you got to do it. What's exceptional to me about video games is the ability to have ENTIRE control (so when I play RTS I want to be able a single unit from FPS stand point or RTS). Demolition INC sort of let's you do that as you can manually control a few cars. The physics engine while jumping a car off a ramp then slamming into 3 buildings while hitting a propane tank is quite fun.

Would I recommend this game as something extremely worth playing? Depends on what you like. If it's on sale I would say buy it for sure.

RATING : 6.9/10

review: Schonmal so wütend gewesen das der Drang etwas zu zerstören unerträglich in einem gebrannt hat??? Hier kann jeder Zerstörungsdrang egal wie sehr angestaut befriedigt werden!!! Aus der Vogelperspektive die Scene betrachtend, versucht man  mit diversen Hilfsmitteln Städte überall auf dem Globus verteilt Viertel für Viertel dem Erdboden gleich zu machen. Dies erreicht man indem man Autos in Gebäude krachen lässt nachdem sie zum Beispiel vorher durch eine gut platzierte Öllache außer Kontrolle gebracht hat. Natürlich kann man auch hier und da selber die Hand ans Steuer legen und gezielt in ganze Komplexe rasen!!! Aber nicht alle Gebäude sind mit Autos erreichbar, dafür gibt es dann Hilfsmittel wie einen Meteor der vom Himmel fällt und in spektakulärer Optik eine große Explosion verursacht! Bei den immer kniffeliger werdenen Zerstörungsaufträgen wird man oftmals durch Hilfsmitteln von Questgebern unterstützt. Nach Erledigung einer kleinen Aufgabe lassen sie einem Hilfmittel zukommen die den Levelabschluss erheblich vereinfachen. Und wenn erstmal eine Kettenreaktion ausgelöst wurde, kann dies zu Explosionsverkettungen führen wo das Zerstörerherz vor Freude springt. Ein besonderer Reiz ist eine Direktanbindung an eine Highscore-Liste die den Wiederspielwert ernorm erhöht! Alles in allem ein grafisch und auch spielerisch sehr gelungenes Spiel das eine fesselnde Wirkung hat!

review:
I bought Demolition Inc. awhile back on sale for about $2. It has its moments, but as a proper PC title, it lacks imagination and playability. You are constantly limited in regards to the timer, allocated 'weapons/tools', as well as environmental props. Essentially, you need to use the vehicles that are driving around the allocated areas to force them to destroy buildings. This sounds fun, but it fails on a technical level. The limitations set by the devlopers decreases game longevity as there's no point in returning to the game.  
In addition, the game areas need to be larger and have more happening. Instead of relying mostly on the vehicles, there should be other items, tools, props, as well as other objectives to use and/or complete. I like to support independent companies, but I only recommend this game if it is on sale.

I hope that with the income raised the developers can create a sequel or another title, which will perfect an already decent idea.

4.5/10.

Zaskakująco przyjemna i wciągająca gra. Na szczególną pochwałę zasługuje edytor. Można szybko ogarnąć, co i jak działa, a możliwości stwarza całkiem duże. Od czasów Trackmanii żaden edytor nie wciągnął mnie tak bardzo. Gdy już nasze dzieło jest gotowe, możemy łatwo je opublikować w Steam Workshop. 
Jeśli komuś nie chce się bawić w budowanie, ma do dyspozycji kampanię oraz mapy innych graczy. Niektóre plansze bywają na prawdę pomysłowe i wymagają wytężenia szarych komórek. Ale nie brakuje też takich, które stawiają na totalną demolkę. 
Podsumowując - grę zdecydowanie polecam. Kosztuje bardzo niewiele, a potrafi dać mnóstwo radości. Nie jest to produkcja na lata, ale miło do niej wrócić. 

PLUSY :
+ Przyjemna oprawa audiowizualna
+ Strasznie wciąga
+ Pomysłowe narzędzia zagłady
+ Wymaga myślenia, ale nie męczy
+ Widowisowy silnik fizyczny
+ Łatwy do ogarnięcia edytor
+ Integracja ze Steam Workshop
+ Niska cena
+ Humor i polska wersja językowa

MINUSY :
- Bywa denerwująca
- Jak się spróbuje zrobić całą mapę wypchaną budynkami i wybuchającymi obiektami, które niszczą się w zbliżonym czasie, można otrzymać niezły pokaz slajdów (wiem, czepiam się)
- Czasami mapa może nie chcieć przesłać się do Steam Workshop

review:
I started playing this about a year ago on my tablet. I passed on the PS3 version because I wasn't sure if it was worth the money just to play it on a bigger screen.

After seeing it dirt cheap in the Steam sale though, I thought I'd get it again, and I'm very glad I did.

It's not going to change your life, or eclipse all you have played before it, but what I like about it is that it's quirky and fun. It's one of those games that aren't to demanding on your concentration or brainpower either - perfect as I've got a heavy cold at the moment.

It has level designer and workshop integration so you can share new levels etc.

Definitely worth a try.

review:
Demolition Inc.(解体社)
御薦め:★★★★★★★☆☆☆　クリア：済
 
 パズル。安価で単純且つおもしろい。また、実績解除がある。
 文明の象徴である建物を破壊して地球の緑化を進めるゲーム。
 面は少ないが攻略方法が色々ある。複数の組み合わせが効果的。

 仕様かバグか不明だが、建物内に『牛』を設置することが可能。
 この方法により、壊れにくい建物でも一撃で粉々に崩壊できる。

 気分転換に最適なので一度試されたら良いかとおもいます。

review:
I bought this game to get the achievement for the Great Gift Giveaway contest, and then found myself playing it more after that.  It's easy enough to play and pretty fun to destroy everything with all the items you end up getting.  

The difficulty progression seems a little unbalanced, with some later puzzles much easier than earlier ones, but overall not too bad.  I would like to be able to pause and assess the puzzle before starting the timer, but that's not too big of a deal.

This was on sale for $2.49 when I got it and for that price you can't really go wrong even if you only play it for a couple of hours.

review: Tries its absolute hardest to be Blast Corps (N64), yet comes short by a terrible camera, buggy-feeling controls, and horrid driving controls. review: Demolition, Inc. is a unique real-time strategy that's based on causing complete destruction by using your limited resources or, more accurately, your ol' bag of tricks. You see, you're an alien tasked with leveling cities and the most efficient way of accomplishing your mission is by sabotaging the everyday life of earthlings. That means laying down oil splats on pavements, placing destructive cows to set off chain reactions and various other tools of chaos. It's fun, challenging and beautiful to look at. Demolition, Inc. will provide you with some quick strategic fun!

author: {'steamid': '76561197979084213', 'num_games_owned': 4492, 'num_reviews': 1009, 'playtime_forever': 278, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 278, 'last_played': 1324627200}
review:
Do you like to destroy stuff ? Well, look no further. Demolition Inc. is your game. Your mission is to destroy all buildings using several power-ups that range from slippery goo to earthquake bombs. It looks a bit simple, but it's good fun, believe me ! And the destruction looks cool. 
I'd say there are about 13 missions in total. Some missions seem impossible but you just have to figure out how to use the power-ups properly. It can be a bit frustrating at times. And the game itself is a bit short; it will take most of you about 4 hours to complete it.
Fun game nonetheless !

[Rating: 77/100]
